intro: Coussarea brevicaulis, commonly known as the short-stemmed coussarea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and dense clusters of small, white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface. Coussarea brevicaulis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
